home.header: Find your path in your new life. We'll help you step by step.

main.title: Welcome to Pathways
main.description: This guide will help you navigate your options in Germany. Whether you want to earn money, continue your education, or learn German, we have resources and step-by-step guidance for you. Choose the path that best fits your current situation and goals.

tips.explore_multiple_paths: You can explore multiple paths - they are not mutually exclusive
tips.paths_complement_eachother: Many paths complement each other (e.g., learning German while working)
tips.take_your_time: Take your time to read through each option before deciding

earn_money.title: Earn Money ‚Äì Work & Career
earn_money.description: You want to earn money or gain your first work experience, but you are not yet sure which profession suits you? Here you will find pathways into work and careers ‚Äì even without a perfect school certificate or with limited German skills. Whether it is a job, apprenticeship, internship or voluntary service: there are more options than you might think. We show you where to start and which steps make sense.

tips.no_need_for_plan: You do not need a perfect plan right away. Many paths begin with trying things out.
tips.practical_experience: Practical experience often matters more than certificates, especially at the beginning.
tips.german_skills: German language skills improve significantly through work and practical experience.
tips.low_age_opportunity: Even at the age of 16 or 17, there are legal opportunities to work or prepare for a career.
tips.jobs_at_mecklenburg: In Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, there are many entry-level jobs in: Skilled trades / crafts, Health care & social services, Gastronomy & tourism, Logistics & warehousing, Rural regions often offer more opportunities because skilled workers are needed.
tips.without_contract: Be careful with offers without a contract or with cash payment.
tips.private_offers: Always check private offers to see whether costs apply.
tips.if_unsure: If you are unsure: get advice first (e.g. Jobcenter, Youth Employment Agency). Counselling is free ‚Äì use it!

no_idea.title: I have no idea: What profession? What training?
no_idea.description: This is the case for a lot of people‚Äîdon't panic. Here you can find out: - what options are available - what might suit you - how to learn a profession - where to find support and advice. Even at 16 or 17, there are legal ways to work or prepare for a career. Just click on. You can try out different paths (e.g., internships or vocational preparation) ‚Äì you can always decide later. There are no wrong answers here; the important thing is that you get started. Let's see which path suits you best.

tips.job_centers_advice: Advice from job centers, employment agencies, and youth career agencies is free‚Äîtake advantage of it!
tips.career_guidance_websites: Career guidance websites are very easy to understand and informative‚Äîwatch VIDEOS about different professions and take tests.
tips.several_tests: Take SEVERAL tests for guidance‚Äîa single test is almost never perfect. Which professions are suggested most often?
tips.trial_and_error: Many paths begin with trial and error. Practical experience often counts for more than certificates, especially at the beginning.
tips.check_costs_involved: When it comes to private counseling and placement services, always check first whether there are any costs involved.
tips.be_wary_jobs: Be wary of job offers without a contract or with cash payments.

demand_in_mv.title: Which professions are in demand in MV?
demand_in_mv.description: Where you live makes a difference. Every region needs different professions. This gives you opportunities‚Äîeven without perfect school grades. In Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania, practical professions are particularly sought after: e.g., skilled trades, nursing, gastronomy, or logistics. Here you can find out which professions are really needed in your area and where you can get an apprenticeship, internship, or entry-level position more quickly. You don't have to commit 'forever.' First look, try things out, gain experience ‚Üí then decide.

tips.entry_level_sectors: In Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, there are many entry-level jobs in: Skilled trades / crafts, Health care & social services, Gastronomy & tourism, Logistics & warehousing.
tips.rural_opportunities: Rural areas sometimes even offer more chances - because there is a lack of skillful workers.

bop_internship.title: Career Exploration Internship (BOP)
bop_internship.description: A short internship to try out a profession. You spend a few weeks in a company to see if the job fits you. You gain practical experience in a company and receive support from the Employment Agency or Job Center.

tips.duration: The internship lasts between 1 and 6 weeks. It can be extended to a maximum of 6 weeks.
tips.free_of_charge: Participation in the career orientation internship is free of charge.
tips.remuneration_travel: As a rule, no remuneration is paid. BUT: Travel or accommodation costs can be covered if necessary. Apply to the Jobcenter or Employment Agency to have your costs covered!
tips.prerequisite: The prerequisite is that compulsory schooling has been completed and you are not currently attending school.
tips.important_job_center: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: ALWAYS get the job center involved beforehand: They can check and decide what help you can get! That's why the internship can only start after approval by the job center or employment agency.
